newsitem.title: USA: Heilig-Meyers to complete buy in two weeks.
newsitem.headline: Heilig-Meyers to complete buy in two weeks.

text.p: Furniture giant Heilig-Meyers Co expects to complete its purchase of the Mattress Discounters chain in two weeks and expects an immediate boost in earnings, the company's president said Wednesday.
"It's a very profitable concept and company," Troy Peery, the president and chief operating officer at Richmond-based Heilig-Meyers told Reuters after Wednesday's annual shareholders meeting.
Peery said the company wanted to expand its presence in the $7 billion bedding segment of the home furnishings industry.
"We want to dominate this sector of the business," Peery said.

Combining sales at Mattress Discounters, already the country's largest retail bedding chain, with Heilig-Meyers' other furniture stores, Peery said the company could have $1 billion in bedding sales by the year 2000.
Heilig-Meyers operates 989 stores under the Heilig-Meyers, Rhodes, The RoomStore and Berrios names.
Mattress Discounter had sales of $175 million last year and operates 165 stores in 10 states and Washington D.C.
